thread.title: Anthony Rizzo and John Cusack call on Cubs fans to lift up team
thread.title_full: Anthony Rizzo and John Cusack call on Cubs fans to lift up team | Chicago Sun-Times

title: Anthony Rizzo and John Cusack call on Cubs fans to lift up team
text:
If the Cubs are going to get back into the NLCS they will need a lot of people to step up, and a few people around the team hope a home town crowd can get them over the top.
Sunday night the Bears fell into a 2-0 hole in the series after losing to the Mets 4-1. New York has now beaten the top two pitchers in the Cubs rotation, while holding the Cubs biggest hitters almost completely silent.
To change that, Anthony Rizzo is again hoping a raucous Wrigley Field crowd will bring the team to life.
Tough losses but 3 games in front of the best fans in baseball coming up. Show your pride tomorrow by wearing Cubs gear. (1/2)
— Anthony Rizzo (@ARizzo44) October 19, 2015
Rizzo sent out a similar tweet before the Cubs returned to Chicago in the NLDS, challenging Cubs fans to get loud.
The Cubs now need to win at least two out of the three games coming up at Wrigley Field. They need four of the remaining five in the series to advance.
Rizzo isn’t the only high profile person expecting Cubs fans to shake things up in the series. Longtime Cubs fan and actor John Cusack hasn’t lost his confidence in the team and will try to help get Wrigley as loud as possible.
NyC held serve -Cubs come home – 1st to 4 – the boys will battle back! let's go wild in Chicago !!
— John Cusack (@johncusack) October 19, 2015
In the end, it will be the players on the field who make the difference for the Cubs. Rizzo has been stuck in a 1-8 stretch in the NLCS, he’s 4-26 on the postseason. Two of those hits, however, were Wrigley Field home runs in the NLDS.
